Other

  • JBI (Japan alliance for Bioscience Information) portal site is now open.

Publishment

  • A paper “Promotion of malignant phenotype after disruption of the three-dimensional structure of cultured spheroids from colorectal cancer” was published in Oncotarget.
  • A paper “Construction of a simple evaluation system for the intestinal absorption of an orally administered medicine using Bombyx mori larvae” was published in Drug Discoveries & Therapeutics.
  • A research paper of the analysis of environmental DNA retrieved from petal surfaces of flowering cherry was published in Journal of Plant Research.
  • A paper “YummyData: providing high-quality open life science data” was published in Database.
  • A paper “Differentiated Embryo Chondrocyte plays a crucial role in DNA damage response via transcriptional regulation under hypoxic conditions” was published in PLOS ONE.
  • An interview with four authors of the FANTOM5 collection entitled “Increasing usability of FANTOM5 data” was published in the Research Data at Springer Nature website.
  • Exhibition of services and databases and organizing workshops and forums on ConBio2017
  • PubCaseFinder has been released!
  • A paper “RefEx, a reference gene expression dataset as a web tool for the functional analysis of genes” was published in Scientific Data.
  • NBDC/DBCLS Training: AJACS Kawachi, 24 Aug. 2017
  • JBI (Japan alliance for Bioscience Information) portal site is now open.
  • A paper “HIF-1-mediated suppression of mitochondria electron transport chain function confers resistance to lidocaine-induced cell death” was published in Scientific Reports.
  • The 10th NBDC/DBCLS BioHackathon registration opened
  • A paper “Calculating quality of public high-throughput sequencing data to obtain suitable subset for reanalysis from the Sequence Read Archive” was published in Gigascience.
  • A paper “Identification of functional enolase genes of the silkworm Bombyx mori from public databases with a combination of dry and wet bench processes” was published in BMC Genomics.
  • A paper “Identification of functional enolase genes of the silkworm Bombyx mori from public databases with a combination of dry and wet bench processes” was published in BMC Genomics.
  • A paper “Extremotolerant tardigrade genome and improved radiotolerance of human cultured cells by tardigrade-unique protein” has published in Nature Communications.
  • Presentations at BioHackathon 2016 Symposium are now listed in YouTube.
  • A paper “Tumour resistance in induced pluripotent stem cells derived from naked mole-rats” has published in Nature Communications.
  • A paper “Weighted Enrichment Method for Prediction of Transcription Regulators from Transcriptome and Global Chromatin Immunoprecipitation data” has published in Nucleic Acids Research.
  • A review “Can the silkworm (Bombyx mori) be used as a human disease model?” has published in Drug Discoveries & Therapeutics (Advance Publication).
  • DBCLS Training: AJACSa Mishima 2, 25-26 Feburary 2015
